Kicking off with the launch of the new LEGO sets before the 30th anniversary Pokémon Presents officially revealed the new Gen 10 mainline Pokémon Winds and Waves. items.title: Get an inside look at Nintendo’s official Pokémon Day celebrations [Gallery]
items.summary:
This morning’s Pokémon Presents showcase did not disappoint with confirmation of the upcoming Pokémon XD Gale of Darkness Switch 2 GameCube release and the first look trailer for the new Gen 10 mainline Pokémon Winds and Waves. That, on top of the new LEGO Eevee, Pikachu, Venusaur, Charizard, and Blastoise sets going up for purchase and the release Pokémon FireRed and LeafGreen on Switch and Switch 2 has made for a seriously notable 30th anniversary Pokémon Day thus far. But there’s still more to come as we serve up an inside look at the Pokémon Day celebration inside of the Nintendo Store NEW YORK…

items.title: Get $449 in FREE gear with Lectric’s 49-pound folding XP Lite2 long-range e-bikes from $999, non-bundled models from $799
items.summary:
Lectric’s ongoing Presidents Day e-bike sale with up to $893 savings is slated to end tomorrow night, which only gives you around 38 hours from the time of writing this to secure your next ride. One popular option that is lighter to manage and folds for storage efficiency is Lectric’s XP Lite2 Long-Range e-bikes with $449 in FREE gear at $999 shipped, as well as the more advanced XP Lite2 JW Black Long-Range Belt Drive e-bike with the same bundle at $1,099 shipped. Instead of shelling out $1,448 and $1,548 for these packages, like always, the savings come in the form of bundled gear, whereas actual price cuts are extremely rare. This bundle includes a rear cargo rack, a fender set, an Elite headlight, a suspension seat post, two adjustable mirrors, and an accordion-style folding bike lock. If you don’t care about the bundled gear, you can find the standard XP Lite2 e-bikes for $799 shipped, while the standard XP Lite2 JW Black Belt Drive model goes for $899 shipped. Head below to learn more about these models or you can browse the full lineup of deals at up to $893 off in our original coverage of this sale here.

more…

items.title: Lenovo’s thin and light Snapdragon X Elite OLED touchscreen Copilot+ PC is down to $650 (Save $790)
items.summary:
We are now tracking a deal at Lenovo that drops its Yoga Slim 7x Snapdragon X Elite Copilot+ PC down to $649.99 shipped. Don’t forget to enter promo code SLIM7SALE during checkout to see the discounted price. This is regularly a $1,450 notebook, which is seeing a straight-up 54% or a $790 discount right now. While we’ve seen deals on the 16GB/512GB and 32GB/1TB variants before, discounts on this 16GB/1TB configuration have been hard to come by. This also marks the lowest price we’ve tracked for it so far, making it a pretty good option to consider if you’re after a reliable everyday laptop at a great price.

more…
